Container.Name: plexReport
Container.Description:
This is a Docker for \"plexReport\" - It Creates an email with the latest additions to Plex[br] Forked from original creators page at: https://github.com/bstascavage/plexReport[br][br] [b][span style=\'color: #E80000;\']Directions:[/span][/b][br] [b]/config[/b] : Where the config files will be created.[br][br] After install, run the initial_script.sh:[br] -----------------------------------------[br] [b]docker exec -it plexReport bash[b][br] [b]cd /opt/plexReport[b][br] [b]./initial_setup.sh[b][br] # Follow Prompts[br] [b]exit[b][br] -----------------------------------------[br] You can now edit the email_body.erb and config.yaml with your own settings in your appdata dir[br] To test, run this at the shell:[br] [b]docker exec plexReport plexreport -n -d -t[b][br] ==============================================[br] # To schedule the report to occur regulary:[br] Enter the following command in the unRAID shell. Replace the day/time with what you want:[br][br]
[b]crontab -l | { cat; echo "30 11 * * 5 docker exec plexReport plexreport -n -d"; } | crontab -[b][br] # To keep the cronjob after a reboot, also add the line to your \boot\config\go file.[br] =====================================================================================[br] http://lime-technology.com/forum/index.php?topic=TBD.0
Container.Overview: plexReport generates an email to send to your users with all the latest Plex content
